attributes.action: Disclose the burial place of Syed Sibghatullah Shah Rashdi
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Syed Sibghatullah Shah Rashdi (Honorably known as “Soorehy-o-Baadshah” & Peer Paggaro VI ) was hanged by the British rulers on 20th March 1943 in the Central Jail Hyderabad, Sindh (present day province of Pakistan) on the account of  a sham trial of inciting an armed uprising of Hurs. The body of the great leader had not been handed over to the relatives/followers as per civilized law of Justice and was buried secretly. The government in Pakistan and past British governments have always turned a deaf ear to the Sindhi people’s requests for disclosing the place of burial. The place of burial is important to us because as a tradition of Sufi Muslim community in Sindh, we venerate our spiritual leaders by visiting their grave/shrine and organizing an annual Urs.
